alert.note: Alert for Cassia (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 13 at 4:26PM MDT until August 13 at 5:00PM MDT by NWS Pocatello
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 630 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Minor Flooding caused by excessive rainfall remains possible. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Idaho, including the following counties, Cassia, Oneida and Power. * WHEN...Until 630 PM MDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Dangerous flows over low-water crossings. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 419 PM MDT, Light to moderate rainfall continues to fall across the area. Although the heaviest rain has likely ended, additional minor accumulations falling on saturated ground could lead to some localized flooding. Between 1.5 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen across portions of the area, namely to the northeast of Roy, near Arbon. Accumulations of 1-1.5 inches along the Utah border are also being estimated by doppler radar. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Malta, Juniper, Fort Hall Bannock Peak, Elba, Almo, Sublett Reservoir, Sweetzer Summit, Roy, Bridge, Arbon, Pauline and eastern City Of Rocks. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
